{"step_by_step_thinking": "Sutures are the areas where the bones of the skull connect. Gomphosis is a type of fibrous joint that connects the root of a tooth to the socket in the jawbone. Synchondrosis is a type of cartilaginous joint where bones are joined together by hyaline cartilage. Syndesmosis is a type of fibrous joint where bones are connected by a cord or sheet of fibrous tissue.", "answer_choice": "D. Syndesmosis."}
